page.title: 09The Woodland Pytchley Hunt
page.content: The Hunt meets every Boxing Day morning in the square at Brigstock. Foxes are still hunted and other game is pursued by a variety of shooting parties throughout the winter. The hunt meets on Tuesdays and Saturdays with an average attendance of 60-70 riders. There is a hunt supporters association to help finances. At present the kennels have 60 hounds and 45 beagles. When the puppies are born they are sent out to local people to rear. Farmers send in dead lambs which are fed raw to the hounds. The hunt extends some 20 miles both north and south and 18 miles in breadth. It is bounded on the north by the { {Cottesmore & the Fernie }on the east by the {Fitzwilliam }and on the west by the{Pytchley and Oakley Hunts.}The border line on the south is the river Nene.
